007package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
008
009import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
010
011/**
012 * Represents a Haar feature, usually composed of multiple rectangular patches (of type {@link FeaturePatch}). Instances
013 * of this class make the nodes of a {@link FeatureTree}.
014 *
015 * @author WB
016 */
017public class FeatureNode {
018
019        static final double NO_VALUE = Double.NaN;
020        static final int NO_CHILD = -1;
021        static final int LEFT = 0;
022        static final int RIGHT = 1;
023
024        private final int width, height;
025        private final double threshold;
026        private final double[] values;  // terminal values
027        private final int[] children;   // indexes of child nodes
028        private final FeaturePatch[] patches;
029
030
031        FeatureNode(int width, int height, double threshold, double valL, int childL, double valR, int childR,
032                        FeaturePatch[] patches) {
033                this.width = width;
034                this.height = height;
035                this.threshold = threshold;
036                this.values = new double[] {valL, valR};
037                this.children = new int[] {childL, childR};
038                this.patches = patches;
039        }
040        
041        public double getValue(int dir) {
042                return values[dir];
043        }
044        
045        public boolean hasValue(int dir) {
046                return !Double.isNaN(values[dir]);
047        }
048        
049        public int getChild(int dir) {
050                return children[dir];
051        }
052        
053        public boolean hasChild(int dir) {
054                return children[dir] != NO_CHILD;
055        }
056        
057        public FeaturePatch[] getPatches() {
058                return patches;
059        }
060
061        /**
062         * Evaluates this feature node by applying its rectangular patches.
063         * Returns the branching direction (LEFT or RIGHT), depending on how the normalized patch 
064         * sum compares to the threshold.
065         * @param II input image (as an integral image) 
066         * @param u left position of the candidate subimage
067         * @param v top position of the candidate subimage
068         * @param scale the current scale to be applied
069         * @return The branching direction (LEFT or RIGHT).
070         */
071        public int eval(IntegralImage II, int u, int v, double scale) {
072                // calculate the area of the subimage:  TODO: w,h never change, make more efficient
073                final int w = (int) Math.round(scale * width);
074                final int h = (int) Math.round(scale * height);
075                
076                // calculate variance (std. deviation) for the complete subimage: TODO: do only once for the subimage?
077                double variance = II.getVariance(u, v, u + w - 1, v + h - 1);
078                double stdDev = (variance > 1) ? Math.sqrt(variance) : 1.0;
079
080                // calculate weighted sum over all patches (rectangles) of this feature
081                double patchSum = 0.0;
082                for (FeaturePatch patch : patches) {
083                        // scale the patch's relative position and size
084                        final int ua = u + (int) Math.round(scale *  patch.x);
085                        final int va = v + (int) Math.round(scale *  patch.y);
086                        final int ub = u + (int) Math.round(scale * (patch.x + patch.width) - 1);
087                        final int vb = v + (int) Math.round(scale * (patch.y + patch.height) - 1);
088                        
089                        // add the patch's block sum and apply the assigned weight (pos/neg)
090                        patchSum = patchSum + II.getBlockSum1(ua, va, ub, vb) * patch.weight;
091                }
092                // normalize the sum of all patches by the effective window area:
093                double patchSumNorm = patchSum / (w * h);
094                        
095                // return direction depending on how the normalized patch sum compares to the threshold
096                return (patchSumNorm < threshold * stdDev) ? LEFT : RIGHT;
097        }
098
099
100        public void print(int featureCnt) {
101                System.out.format("     feature %d: w=%d h=%d valL=%.4f valR=%.4f childL=%d childR=%d th=%.4f patches=%d\n", 
102                                featureCnt, width, height, getValue(LEFT), getValue(RIGHT), getChild(LEFT), getChild(RIGHT), 
103                                threshold, patches.length);
104                int patchCnt = 0;
105                for (FeaturePatch patch : patches) {
106                        System.out.println("           patch " + patchCnt + " " + patch.toString());
107                        patchCnt++;
108                }
109        }
110}
